intro: Verbesina baruensis, commonly known as the Borneo goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while the flowers are arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Verbesina baruensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for various insect species.
